title: The injury bug is starting to severely sting the Boston Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "We miss our guys that aren't here.
Let's be upfront about that.
" Marco Sturm and the Bruins are dealing with the injury bug over the last few weeks.

title: Meet the cast of ‘The Real Housewives of Rhode Island’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: TV Andy Cohen announced the “Real Housewives of Rhode Island” cast — including a former local NBC news anchor, a URI alum, and a Cranston pizzeria co-owner.
Andy Cohen attends the PAC NYC Icons of Culture Gala at Perelman Performing Arts Center on Tuesday, Oct.
28, 2025, in New York.

title: ‘Deeply ashamed’: Larry Summers will step back from public roles as relationship with Epstein revealed
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The former president of Harvard regularly emailed with Jeffrey Epstein from 2017 until his death, according to documents released by the House Oversight Committee.
Former Treasury Secretary Larry Summers at his home in Brookline on June 22, 2021.

David Degner/The New York Times Larry Summers, the former president of Harvard University, said he will be “stepping back” from public commitments as some of his regular email exchanges with Jeffrey Epstein became public.

title: Former Boston City Councilor Tania Fernandes Anderson finishes month-long prison sentence
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The former city councilor, of Roxbury, was no longer in the custody of the Federal Bureau of Prisons as of Friday.
Former Boston City Councilor Tania Fernandes Anderson stops to talk with the media as she departs the US District John J.
Moakley Courthouse.

title: Two North Shore restaurants close after 78 years
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Food News Hawthorne by the Sea and Anthony’s Pier 4 Café in Swampscott closed on Saturday.
In this photo taken in October 1968, Anthony Athanas, the owner of Anthony’s Pier 4 in Boston, stirred chowder as food editors watched.
His family announced the closing of Hawthorne by the Sea in Swampscott, along with Anthony’s Pier 4 Café.

title: Report: Bengals’ Ja’Marr Chase suspended for Patriots game after spitting incident
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots The NFL determined that Chase spit on Jalen Ramsey last week, leading to a one-game suspension.
Ja'Marr Chase AP Photo/Matt Durisko The Patriots will likely avoid playing one of the NFL’s most productive receivers this week.
According to NFL Media’s Ian Rapoport, Cincinnati’s Ja’Marr Chase has been suspended for Sunday’s game against New England for spitting on Pittsburgh’s Jalen Ramsey during an altercation last week.

title: Harvard custodians go on strike
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News Over 800 custodians walked off the job demanding fair wage increases.

Sophie Park, File On Monday morning, hundreds of custodians holding purple 32BJ SEIU “Harvard On Strike” signs walked off the job, marching through Harvard Yard in Cambridge and demanding fair wage increases.
The strike began Monday at 10 a.

title: What Mike Vrabel said about missing Milton Williams for the ‘foreseeable future’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Williams is working hard to get back, Vrabel said, but the Patriots will be without him for a while.
Milton Williams.

AP Photo/Gary McCullough FOXBOROUGH – Milton Williams will miss at least four games after the Patriots placed him on injured reserve with a high-ankle sprain, but Mike Vrabel isn’t ready to talk about his season in the past tense.
